info.name: Owner's Choice

info.description: Buy low, sell high, and make the right choice as a majority owner to come out the richest by the game's end
info.helpText:
Have all players take a seat and then click the Setup button to create a random board and pick a start player.

The pawn is the only player component which should be dragged and dropped - to take most other actions in the game you should instead use the buttons in the player areas and in the central company area.

The implementation will allow you to sell all of your shares of a company - this is helpful in bankruptcy and end-game situations as described below. However, recall that you are not allowed to sell your final share if nobody else owns a share of that company.

Specific situations:
- COMPANY SPACE: Either: (A) pay 50 (or 100 if price is in the high-price green area of the market) to the fund using the "50 → FUND" button in your player area, then click the company spinner; or (B) click the fund spinner and resolve the result.
- RECEIVE THE WHOLE FUND: When rolling the Fund die and getting a Raid result, you take the entire contents of the fund. Click the "50 ← FUND" button in the relevant player area until there is nothing left in the fund.
- BANKRUPTCY: Reduce the company's price to zero and then have all players sell their shares with their Sell buttons. (They will receive no money as the price is zero.) Then increase the price back to 100.
- END GAME: Have the player moving the pawn to the Goal space take up to $100 from the fund by clicking the "50 ← FUND" button in their player area twice. Then click the End Game button and confirm you're happy to end the game. This will sell all shares at once, after which the player with the most cash then wins the game.
- FIXING MISTAKES: If you accidentally take or give money to the fund, or accidentally buy or sell shares, you can usually reverse this by doing the opposite. (You may need another player to buy and/or sell a share too in order to get the presidency in the right place.) if you accidentally pay dividends or take money from the bank when you should not have, then you can undo this by manually adjusting players' cash totals - click on the large dollar bills to bring up the UI to edit their value.

clickRoutine: var header = 'Enter new value for ' + ${PROPERTY id}

loopRoutine: var total = ${PROPERTY dividend OF $marker} * ${PROPERTY text OF $counter}

spinner-red.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#e34234 !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

spinner-green.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#7cfc00 !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

spinner-blue.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#1e90ff !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

spinner-yellow.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#ffef00 !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

spinner-fund.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#ffffff !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

spinner-event.valueCSS: background-color: #000000; color:#ffffff !important; scale: 60%; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; line-height:0.8em;

clickRoutine.note: Reset the board squares ready to set the board up
Recall the board randomiser cards
Select the board randomiser cards
...and randomise their active face
Select the board 1 card
Move the board 1 card to the active holder
Shuffle the board 2-4 cards
Setup segment 1 from the board 1 card
Move the board 1 card to the discard
Move the card for segment 2 into the active holder
Setup segment 2 from the board 1 card
Move the card for segment 2 to the discard
Move the card for segment 3 into the active holder
Setup segment 3 from the board 1 card
Move the card for segment 3 to the discard
Move the card for segment 4 into the active holder
Setup segment 4 from the board 1 card
Select the red share price marker
Additionally select the green share price marker
Additionally select the blue share price marker
Additionally select the yellow share price marker
Set all stock prices to 100
Set player starting cash to $690
